title: Psychological impact
comment: Just because the implant makes it so you don't feel tired, doesn't mean it is healthy to go days without sleeping. This could encourage extremely long working days or students who study all night and end up suffering mentally because of it.

title: Is metabolising the implant dangerous?
comment: This might be safe to do, but the implant is near the brain which mike make this dangerous

title: Data privacy
comment: Would companies/governments be able to monitor brain activity and potentially use this e.g., for advertising health care products

title: Powered by body's resources
comment: Depending on how much of the brains blood supply this uses, it could be concerning that resources are being diverted away from essential body processes towards the implant

title: Device is near the brain?
comment: It sounds very risky to have the implant installed near the brain, could it potentially cause damage or infections which could risk lives?

title: Should children be able to use it?
comment: This could be positive because it would help children get well rested and concentrate more at school. However, should parents be able to control the app and force children to sleep and wake at certain times? This seems abusive.

title: dependency
comment: People might end up being dependent on using the implant and they'll struggle to sleep even more without it

title: Don't waste time trying to get to sleep
Helping insomniacs
comment: This is a serious condition and would be treated very effectively with an implant like this, improving many people's lives. Maybe the implant should only be allowed to be used as a medical device for insomniacs?

title: Hacking
comment: People might want to hack the devices to steal information (e.g., about health) or to force people to sleep/wake when they don't want to). If you knew everyone was asleep and wouldn't wake up until 9am then you could rob them easier etc
